p: In 2013, MERS-CoV also triggered an epidemic in the Middle East and a major outbreak in South Korea occurred in Mayâ€“June 2015 (Kim et al. 2017a). With a case-fatality rate of 35.5%, MERS-CoV is heavily endemic in dromedary camels and causes lower respiratory tract infections in humans (Kim et al. 2017a). Although the SARS-CoV epidemic had been under control for years, Wang et al. ( 2017) warned that re-emergence of this threatening infection posed a possible global risk as potentially new strains of SARS-CoV would be more dangerous than the previous ones.
